column4: did ubuntu break standby mode recently (since last round of updates)? Suspend no longer works. The system just beeps on startup and I am forced to restart with a reset

either ubuntu broke suspend on my machine during last updates or after being instructed to test the latest vanilla kernel (maverick). Any ideas if the kernel would cause any tools to update in a way that would break the system suspend?
Linux compaq 2.6.18-bootsplash+ipset+u32+ipp2p+mms+sip-1 #1 Tue May 13 12:18:52 EDT 2008 i686 GNU/Linux
oops, wrong machine, sec :)
so don't use the maverick kernel?
im not, but i did boot it once to test something. just putting it out there. I just pasting the `uname -a` of what i am actually runing now
then don't say you're using it, that's confusing :)
sorry, bad wording. Not "using", had "tried" it to test for a problem for a bug report.
anyway, it shouldn't have affected anything else afaik
thats what I am thinking. but its either that or the last update to the system from proposed. just here checking if anyone else might have noticed it
what was your reasoning for testing the kernel?
I was asked by a dev in a bug report
right, but regarding what?
a dvd problem. seems the latest kernel is fine with it
ok, just figured maybe it was related
nah. but as I was saying, this only happened the last 2 days, and the only thing that happened since was the .35 test and a package update
do you know what packages were updated?
not off hand. was some stuff from proposed and some stuff from security. i'd have to go through the logs
hmm, proposed isn't really meant to be used as a an "always-on" repository
ya, might just be the first time ive been bitten by having it on. i don't want to disable it now though in case I start getting missing dependancy issues
you won't get missing dependency issues
even if I remove something that was updated to a higher version than is stock and they depend on stuff that was from proposed or pulled in from it?
you're removing things, dependencies aren't required to remove something and apt would tell you if other things depend on it
well, guess ill disable it than, thanks
